meanings.definition: The quality or state of being forgeable.
meanings.sent1: The forgeabilities of the metal allowed it to be shaped into intricate designs.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith tested the forgeabilities of the new material by heating it in the furnace.
meanings.sent3: The forgeabilities of the clay made it easy for the potter to mold it into various shapes.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had the forgeabilities of a master sculptor, shaping ideas into beautiful art.
meanings.sent5: The forgeabilities of the dough were evident as it transformed into perfectly baked bread.

meanings.definition: The ability to be forged or shaped by heat and pressure.
meanings.sent1: The forgeabilities of the metal allowed it to be shaped into intricate designs.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith tested the forgeabilities of the new material by heating it in the furnace.
meanings.sent3: The forgeabilities of the clay made it easy for the potter to mold it into various shapes.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had the forgeabilities of a master sculptor, shaping ideas into beautiful art.
meanings.sent5: The forgeabilities of the dough were evident as it transformed into perfectly baked bread.
